topic.title: Stage 3 proposal: Feature #13107

section.title: Approved technical requirements
section.p: The processor default values for @scope, @format, and @type make sense for local DITA topic references. However, for some common links, especially those to external HTTP URLs, the processor defaults can cause problems in some processors, resulting in a need to set those attributes explicitly. The default values should be informed by value of the @href attribute.

section.title: Modified Topic: The scope attribute
section.p: The text in the topic common/thescopeattribute.dita that describes the default value for the attribute will be modified.

entry.p: If no value is specified, but the attribute is specified on an ancestor within a map or within the related-links section, the value will cascade from the closest ancestor. The processing default is local.

If no value is specified, but the attribute is specified on an ancestor within a map or within the related-links section, the value will cascade from the closest ancestor. The processing default is determined by the value of the href attribute. If the href attribute specifies an absolute URI whose scheme is http, https, ftp, or mailto, then the processing default is external. In all other cases, the processing default is local.

section.title: Modified Topic: The format attribute
section.p: As currently constructed, the topic describing the format attribute (common/theformatattrribute.dita) specifies its normative information in its shortdesc element, so some minor restructuring is required.

entry.p: The format attribute identifies the format of the resource being cross referenced. The processing default for format is dita. If no value is specified, but the attribute is specified on an ancestor within a map or within the related-links section, the value will cascade from the closest ancestor.

row.entry: The format attribute identifies the format of the resource being cross referenced. If no value is specified, but the attribute is specified on an ancestor within a map or within the related-links section, the value will cascade from the closest ancestor.

dlentry.dd: The processing default, as described below, is used.

entry.p: The processing default for the format attribute is determined by inspecting the value of the href attribute. Generally, if the href attribute specifies a file extension, the processing default for the format attribute will be that extension, after conversion to lower-case, and with no leading period. The only exception to this is if the extension is xml, in which case the default format is dita. If there is no extension, but the href value is an absolute URI whose scheme is http or https, then the processing default is html. In all other cases where no extension is available, the processing default is dita.

section.title: The type attribute
section.p: The topic describing the @type attribute will not be modified for this feature. The Phase 2 proposal stated that when an <xref> element where @scope=local and @format=dita specifies an @href with a slash in the fragment identifier, but no explicit or inherited @type attribute, then, there is no effective default value. In such cases, if the effective @scope is "local", processors should determine the effective value by examining the link target, per the current rules. In reviewing the current spec language as well as the e-mail discussion that led to proposal #13024 (https://lists.oasis-open.org/archives/dita/200907/msg00100.html), I don't think a processing default that requires the inspection of the actual target is appropriate. So the default value for @type will continue to be topic, and processors continue to have maximum flexibility in how, when, and whether to validate that value.
